member.name: T:Aspose.Gis.AbstractPath
member.summary: An AbstractPath is a base class for classes that specify a unique location in an environment similar to a filesystem, like a local filesystem, a remote file storage or a ZIP archive, among others.
member.remarks:
An AbstractPath might specify a location on a local filesystem, a location on a remote filesystem or an external storage like the Azure Blob storage, and so on. The location might point to an existing or not existing file-like objects, directory-like objects, or have any other meaning reasonable for the environment it belongs to.
As an example, an AbstractPath inheritor that represents a location on the local filesystem can point to an existing file, directory, or to a place in the filesystem that has not been created yet. In order to make a new filesystem-like storage available to Aspose.GIS, one should inherit this class and implement its abstract methods.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.AbstractPath.FromLocalPath(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an that represents a location on the local filesystem.
member.param: A path on the local filesystem, like "C:\\file.shp" or "D:\\directory\\".
member.returns: An that represents the location defined by the .

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.AbstractPath.FromStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates an from a .
member.param: A stream to create an from. Aspose.GIS does not dispose the stream.
member.returns: An instance of with the specified as its content.
member.remarks: This method is useful for passing a stream of data in a single-file format (such as GeoJSON or KML) to methods that expect an .

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.AbstractPath.Location
member.summary: Gets a string representation of the location of this AbstractPath.
member.remarks: Any two s that equal s point to the same file or directory. The string representation must use to separate directory levels. As an example, for the local file system a location is a filesystem path, for Azure blobs it can be a path to the blob within a blob container.

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.AbstractPath.Separator
member.summary: Gets a separator character used to separate directory levels of the string.
member.value: A separator character used to separate directory levels of the string.
member.remarks: Usually this is equal to forward '/' or backward slash '\\'.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.AbstractPath.IsFile
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this path points to an existing file that can be opened for reading.
member.returns: if location points to a file; otherwise.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.AbstractPath.Delete
member.summary: Deletes a file pointed to by this path.
member.remarks: No exception is thrown if the file doesn't exist.
member.exception: The argument points to a directory instead of a file.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.AbstractPath.Open(System.IO.FileAccess)
member.summary: Opens this AbstractPath as a file.
member.param: Specifies a subset of operations that can be performed on a .
member.returns: A opened with the specified .
member.remarks: If has the flag set, and the file does not exist, an inheritor must create it. An AbstractPath can be opened multiple times by Aspose.GIS. This is required in order to read a file independently with multiple streams. You should not cache the result but rather return new every time this method is called.

member.summary: Returns paths located inside this AbstractPath, if it's a directory.

member.returns: A new pointing to a that is a combination of locations of this and the argument.

member.summary: Returns a new with the file extension changed to the specified value.
member.returns: A new , that points to a file in the same directory, but with a new extension.
member.remarks: Usually, an inheritor should not override this method. The default implementation substitutes the extension and calls .

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.AbstractPath.GetFileName
member.summary: Returns the file name and extension of this .
member.returns: The characters after the last character in the . If the last character is the character, an empty string is returned. If there is no characters in the , the itself is returned.
member.example: For an AbstractPath with equal to "/directory/file.txt" and equal to '/', this method returns "file.txt".

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.AbstractPath.GetFileNameWithoutExtension
member.summary: Returns the file name of this without the extension.
member.returns: The string returned by minus the last period and all characters following it.
member.example: For an AbstractPath with equal to "/directory/file.txt" and equal to '/', this method returns "file".

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.AbstractPath.GetExtension
member.summary: Returns the extension of this .
member.returns: The extension of this (including the period ".") or an empty string if the has no extension.
member.example: For an AbstractPath with equal to "/directory/file.txt" this property returns ".txt".

member.name: T:Aspose.Gis.Formats.FileGdb.FileGdbCoordinatePrecisionGrid
member.summary: A coordinate precision grid inside a FileGDB layer.
member.remarks:
The coordinate precision grid defines the valid domain and resolution of coordinates in FileGDB layer. Origin defines the Path to coordinate precision grid in space. Scale defines the resolution (the larger scale is, the more precise values are written). Precision grid specifies the valid range of values for coordinates:
XMin = XOrigin YMin = YOrigin ZMin = ZOrigin MMin = MOrigin XMax = XOrigin + 9e+15 / XYScale YMax = YOrigin + 9e+15 / XYScale ZMax = ZOrigin + 9e+15 / ZScale MMax = MOrigin + 9e+15 / MScale
Every coordinate in the must be within this range. Coordinates that are outside of the range may cause read errors later on and will be processed wrong by ArcGIS. If you don't specify any properties (keep them ) the default values are will be used. Default values depends on of the . For geographic defaults are:
XOrigin = -400 YOrigin = -400 ZOrigin = -1e5 MOrigin = -1e5 XYScale = 1e9 ZScale = 1 / ZTolerance * 10 MScale = 1 / MTolerance * 10
For projected defaults are:
XOrigin = -2147483647 YOrigin = -2147483647 ZOrigin = -1e5 MOrigin = -1e5 XYScale = 1 / XYTolerance * 10 ZScale = 1 / ZTolerance * 10 MScale = 1 / MTolerance * 10
where XYTolerance, ZTolerance and MTolerance are values from .

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.Formats.FileGdb.FileGdbCoordinatePrecisionGrid.CreateFromRectangle(Aspose.Gis.Geometries.IPoint,Aspose.Gis.Geometries.IPoint)
member.summary: Creates new FileGdbCoordinatePrecisionGrid such that all values within a rectangle are representable.
member.param: Opposite corner of the rectangle. Must have same dimensions as .
member.returns: The FileGdbCoordinatePrecisionGrid such that all values within a rectangle are representable. Values outside of the rectangle are not representable, so all coordinates that will be written to FileGDB layer must be inside the rectangle.
member.exception:
and don't form a valid non empty rectangle:
or is empty.
'HasZ' flags of does not equal to 'HasZ' flag of
'HasM' flags of does not equal to 'HasM' flag of
'X' coordinate of is equal to 'X' coordinate of
'Y' coordinate of is equal to 'Y' coordinate of
'Z' coordinate of is equal to 'Z' coordinate of
'M' coordinate of is equal to 'M' coordinate of
Any coordinate is or infinity.

member.summary: Gets or sets the scale of X and Y coordinates. If set to the default is used.
member.remarks: Default value is 1e9 for with geographic and XYScale = 1 / XYTolerance * 10 for with projected .

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.FileGdb.FileGdbOptions.ObjectIdFieldName
member.summary: Name of the object ID field.
member.remarks: This is a creation option and it does not affect reading. Defines the name of the object ID field (column). Defaults to "OBJECTID". If any attribute in has name equal to the value of this property, then this attribute is renamed.
member.exception:
Value is not a valid field name. A valid field name must:
Be not and not empty
Start with Latin letter or underscore
Contain only Latin letters, digits or underscores

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.FileGdb.FileGdbOptions.GeometryFieldName
member.summary: Name of the geometry field.
member.remarks: This is a creation option and it does not affect reading. Defines the name of the geometry field (column). Defaults to "SHAPE". If any attribute in has name equal to the value of this property, then this attribute is renamed.
member.exception:
Value is not a valid field name. A valid field name must:
Be not and not empty
Start with Latin letter or underscore
Contain only Latin letters, digits or underscores

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.FileGdb.FileGdbOptions.XYTolerance
member.summary: X and Y snapping tolerance.
member.remarks: This is a creation option and it does not affect reading. This parameter controls a snapping tolerance used for advanced ArcGIS features. It does not affect Aspose.GIS behavior, but it can be used by ArcGIS. The unit of the parameter is the unit of spatial reference system. If set to , the default is used. The default depends on spatial reference system and equals to 0.000000008983153 degrees for geographic systems or 0.001 meters for projected systems (values are transformed to spatial reference system units). If spatial reference system is unknown the default is 0.001.

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.FileGdb.FileGdbOptions.ZTolerance
member.summary: Z snapping tolerance.
member.remarks: This is a creation option and it does not affect reading. This parameter controls a snapping tolerance used for advanced ArcGIS features. It does not affect Aspose.GIS behavior, but it can be used by ArcGIS. The unit of the parameter is the unit of spatial reference system. If set to , the default is used. If spatial reference system is unknown or has less than three dimensions the default is 0.001. If spatial reference system has three dimensions the default is 0.001 meters converted to the unit of the third dimension.

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.FileGdb.FileGdbOptions.MTolerance
member.summary: M snapping tolerance.
member.remarks: This is a creation option and it does not affect reading. This parameter controls a snapping tolerance used for advanced ArcGIS features. It does not affect Aspose.GIS behavior, but it can be used by ArcGIS. The unit of the parameter is the unit of spatial reference system. If set to , the default is used. The default is 0.001.

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.FileGdb.FileGdbOptions.CoordinatePrecisionGrid
member.summary: A coordinate precision grid to use in new layer.
member.remarks: This is a creation option and it does not affect reading. The coordinate precision grid defines the valid domain and resolution of coordinates in FileGDB. When this property is set to default values are used. Refer to documentation for more details on coordinate precision grids.

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.FileGdb.FileGdbOptions.EnsureValidCoordinatesRange
member.summary: Whether coordinates should be in valid range.
member.remarks: This is a creation option and it does not affect reading. If set to an exception will be thrown on attempt to write a coordinate with values out of valid range. If set to such coordinate will be written silently. Valid range is defined by . Refer to documentation to read about how valid range is determined from coordinate precision grid. Default is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.Gml.GmlOptions.LoadSchemasFromInternet
member.summary: Determines whether Aspose.GIS is allowed to load XML schema from Internet. If set to , schemas with absolute URIs that does not start with 'file://' would not be loaded. Default is .
member.remarks: Aspose.GIS uses XML schema of GML file in order to create . XML schema files can be distributed alongside with GML files or can be located on the Internet. In former case, you need to set this option to to allow Aspose.GIS to load XML schema.

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.Gml.GmlOptions.XmlResolver
member.summary: A used to resolve external resources. Default is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.Gml.GmlOptions.NestedPropertiesSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that is used to separate components of nested attributes. Default is "_".

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.Gml.GmlOptions.SchemaLocation
member.summary: Space separated list of URI pairs. First URI in every pair is a URI of the namespace, second URI is a Path to XML schema of the namespace. If set to , will try read schemaLocation from the root element of the document. Default is .

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.Gml.GmlOptions.RestoreSchema
member.summary: Determines whether Aspose.GIS is allowed to parse attributes in a Gml file in which an XML schema is missing or cannot be loaded. If set to , Aspose.GIS reader does not require the presence of an XML Schema. Default is .
member.remarks: Driver attempts to automatically parse the feature classes and their associated properties by scanning the file and looking for “known” objects to determine the organization. While this approach is error prone, it has the advantage of working for GML files even if the associated XML schema has been lost or cannot load from Internet.

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.Gpx.GpxOptions.ZAttribute
member.summary: Determines which GPX attribute will be exported as 'Z' coordinate of waypoints, route points and track points. If - no attribute will be exported as 'Z' coordinate. Defaults to "ele". Possible values are names of all GPX XML attribute that can be represented as double (e.g. "speed", "magvar", "geoidheight" etc.)

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.Gpx.GpxOptions.MAttribute
member.summary: Determines which GPX attribute will be exported as 'M' coordinate of waypoints, route points and track points. Behavior is same with , defaults to .

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.Gpx.GpxOptions.WritePolygonsAsLines
member.summary: Determines if transformation of polygon or multipolygon to linestring is allowed. Defaults to .

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.Gpx.GpxOptions.ReadNestedAttributes
member.summary: Determines if GPX points, such as 'trkpt' and 'rtept', contain inner attributes and if it should be read. Defaults to .

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.Gpx.GpxOptions.NestedAttributeSeparator
member.summary: A string to separate nested attribute name and its indexes. Defaults to double underscore "__".

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.MapInfoInterchange.MapInfoInterchangeOptions.TextStringAttribute
member.summary: Specifies name of the attribute that represents text of 'Text' graphical object.
member.remarks: MapInfo Interchange Format specifies a graphical object of type 'Text'. 'Text' graphical object represents a label on a map. We export 'Text' graphical objects as a with geometry that bounds the label. Text of the label is exported as . This property specifies the name of the attribute that is used to export text of the label. Default value is "textstring".

member.name: T:Aspose.Gis.Formats.TopoJson.TopoJsonOptions
member.summary: Driver-specific options for TopoJSON format.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.Formats.TopoJson.TopoJsonOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Create new instance.

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.TopoJson.TopoJsonOptions.NestedPropertiesSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that is used to separate components of nested attributes. Default is "_".
member.remarks: This is reading option - it does not affect writing.

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.TopoJson.TopoJsonOptions.ObjectNameAttribute
member.summary: Name of the attribute, that reflects the name of the object that contains a feature.
member.remarks: TopoJSON may contain any number of named objects. Every such object can contain multiple features. Refer to TopoJSON specification to more detail on named objects. When reading TopoJSON, this property specifies, what attribute should reflect name of the object that contains a feature. When writing TopoJSON, this property specifies, what attribute should be used to group features in objects. Default is "topojson_object_name".

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.TopoJson.TopoJsonOptions.DefaultObjectName
member.summary: Name of the object where features are put by default.
member.remarks: This is writing option - it does not affect reading. TopoJSON may contain any number of named objects. Every such object can contain multiple features. In order to specify in which object to put your feature, use property. If attribute with name is or unset for some feature, this feature is added to object with the name . If attribute with name is not present in collection, all features are put into object with name . Default value is "unnamed".

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.TopoJson.TopoJsonOptions.Transform
member.summary: Specifies transform object to use to quantize coordinates and delta-encode arcs in output TopoJSON.
member.remarks: This is writing option - it does not affect reading. This option is mutually exclusive with - only one of this two options can be not . If this is not - output TopoJSON coordinates are quantized and arcs are delta-encoded with the specified transform object. Refer to TopoJSON specification for more details on transform object. Defaults to .

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Formats.TopoJson.TopoJsonOptions.QuantizationNumber
member.summary: Specifies quantization number to use to quantize coordinates and delta-encode arcs in output TopoJSON.
member.remarks: This is writing option - it does not affect reading. This option is mutually exclusive with - only one of this two options can be not . If this is not - output TopoJSON coordinates are quantized and arcs are delta-encoded with the specified quantization number. Quantization number determines the maximum number of expressible values per dimension in the resulting quantized coordinates; typically a power of ten is chosen. Defaults to .

member.name: T:Aspose.Gis.Formats.TopoJson.TopoJsonTransform
member.summary: A transform object that can be used in order to quantize coordinates when writing a TopoJSON file.
member.remarks: Refer to TopoJSON specification for more details on transform object.

member.name: T:Aspose.Gis.Geometries.CircularString
member.summary: A multi-vertex curve with circular interpolation between points.
member.remarks: The CircularString consists of one or more circular arc segments connected end to end. The first three points define the first segment. The first point is the start point of the arc. The second point is any intermediate point on the arc other than the start or end point. The third point is the end of the arc. Subsequent arcs are defined by their intermediate and end points only, as the start point is implicitly defined as the previous segment's end point.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.Geometries.Geometry.Crosses(Aspose.Gis.Geometries.IGeometry)
member.summary: Determines if this geometry and a specified geometry cross.
member.returns: if this geometry is "spatially crosses" another geometry. otherwise.
member.remarks: This method tests whether geometries are crosses in terms of DE-9IM intersection matrix. Two geometries cross each other if they have some but not all interior points in common and the dimension of the intersection is less then dimension of at least one of the geometries. That is: two s cross, if they form an 'X' letter, a LineString and a cross if LineString goes through interior of a Polygon. See OpenGIS Simple Features Specification for more details about DE-9IM and "spatially crosses" relation.
member.exception: One of the geometries is invalid in such way that operation can not be finished.
of geometries are not equivalent. You can use in order to convert geometries to the same spatial reference system.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.Geometries.Geometry.Covers(Aspose.Gis.Geometries.IGeometry)
member.summary: Determines whether this geometry covers a specified geometry.
member.returns: if this geometry is "spatially covers" another geometry. otherwise.
member.remarks:
This method tests whether one geometry covers another in terms of DE-9IM intersection matrix. One geometry covers another one, if the geometry contains every point of another geometry. This method is similar to , but returns more often, since it does not distinguish between interior and boundary points. So, if geometry A lies on boundary of geometry B, returns , while this method returns . This method is equivalent to:
this.Relate(other, "T*****FF*") || this.Relate(other, "*T****FF*") || this.Relate(other, "***T**FF*) || this.Relate(other, "***T*FF*");
member.exception: One of the geometries is invalid in such way that operation can not be finished.
of geometries are not equivalent. You can use in order to convert geometries to the same spatial reference system.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.Geometries.Geometry.CoveredBy(Aspose.Gis.Geometries.IGeometry)

member.name: T:Aspose.Gis.Geometries.ICircularString
member.summary: A multi-vertex curve with circular interpolation between points.
member.remarks: The CircularString consists of one or more circular arc segments connected end to end. The first three points define the first segment. The first point is the start point of the arc. The second point is any intermediate point on the arc other than the start or end point. The third point is the end of the arc. Subsequent arcs are defined by their intermediate and end points only, as the start point is implicitly defined as the previous segment's end point.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.Geometries.IGeometry.Crosses(Aspose.Gis.Geometries.IGeometry)
member.summary: Determines if this geometry and a specified geometry cross.
member.returns: if this geometry is "spatially crosses" another geometry. otherwise.
member.remarks: This method tests whether geometries are crosses in terms of DE-9IM intersection matrix. Two geometries cross each other if they have some but not all interior points in common and the dimension of the intersection is less then dimension of at least one of the geometries. That is: two s cross, if they form an 'X' letter, a LineString and a cross if LineString goes through interior of a Polygon. See OpenGIS Simple Features Specification for more details about DE-9IM and "spatially crosses" relation.
member.exception: One of the geometries is invalid in such way that operation can not be finished.
of geometries are not equivalent. You can use in order to convert geometries to the same spatial reference system.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.Geometries.IGeometry.Covers(Aspose.Gis.Geometries.IGeometry)
member.summary: Determines whether this geometry covers a specified geometry.
member.returns: if this geometry is "spatially covers" another geometry. otherwise.
member.remarks:
This method tests whether one geometry covers another in terms of DE-9IM intersection matrix. One geometry covers another one, if the geometry contains every point of another geometry. This method is similar to , but returns more often, since it does not distinguish between interior and boundary points. So, if geometry A lies on boundary of geometry B, returns , while this method returns . This method is equivalent to:
this.Relate(other, "T*****FF*") || this.Relate(other, "*T****FF*") || this.Relate(other, "***T**FF*) || this.Relate(other, "***T*FF*");
member.exception: One of the geometries is invalid in such way that operation can not be finished.
of geometries are not equivalent. You can use in order to convert geometries to the same spatial reference system.

of geometries are not equivalent. You can use in order to convert geometries to the same spatial reference system.

This geometry is invalid in a such way, that operation can not be completed.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.Geometries.Surface.ToLinearGeometry
member.summary: Gets approximate or equivalent non-curve version of this geometry using the default tolerance.
member.returns:
A that approximates or equivalent to this ISurface. This is the equivalent of with default tolerance. Default tolerances value is dependent on of this geometry:
For projected SRS Tolerance is 0.001 meters (in SRS units)
For geographic SRS Tolerance is 1e-5 degrees (in SRS units)
For unknown SRS Tolerance is 1e-5 For more details on what transformations are applied refer to specification.
member.exception: This geometry is invalid in a such way, that operation can not be completed.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.Geometries.Surface.ToLinearGeometry(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets approximate or equivalent non-curve version of this geometry using the specified tolerance.
member.param: The tolerance to use. The result is guaranteed to be less than tolerance away from the curved geometry, unless the number of points needed to linearize the geometry exceeds the per-quadrant maximum, currently equal to 10000 points.
member.returns:
A that approximates or equivalent to this ISurface:
If this object is itself the result is equivalent to this object If this object is not it is linearized and is created
member.exception: tolerance is less than or equal to 0.
This geometry is invalid in a such way, that operation can not be completed.

member.name: T:Aspose.Gis.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder that contains the Aspose component assembly.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder that contains the entry (startup) assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic") Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: T:Aspose.Gis.NumericFormat
member.summary: are used to format common numeric types in text.
member.remarks:
There are three types of :
General - fixed-point or scientific notation. Some number of digits are significant.
RoundTrip - fixed-point or scientific notation. Max of digits are significant.
Flat - fixed-point notation. Some number of digits are significant. A can be set to via in order to specify the numeric format when translating geometry to its Well-Known Text (WKT) representation.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.NumericFormat.General(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a number to the more compact of either fixed-point or scientific notation, depending on the type of the number and whether a precision specifier is present. Recommended to use.
member.remarks: Internally code is generating number strings for WKT via: coordinate.ToString("G", CultureInfo.InvariantCulture).
member.param: The precision defines the maximum number of significant digits that can appear in the result string. If the precision is zero, the value "15" is used. The maximum available precision is "17".
member.returns: The General Format Specifier.
member.exception: Number of significant digits is less then 0 or more than 17.

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.NumericFormat.RoundTrip
member.summary: Converts and attempts to ensure that a numeric value that is converted to a string is parsed back into the same numeric value.
member.remarks: Internally code is generating number strings for WKT via: coordinate.ToString("R", CultureInfo.InvariantCulture) decision.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.NumericFormat.Flat(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a number to a fixed-point text without a scientific notation.
member.remarks: Internally code is generating number strings for WKT via: coordinate.ToString("0.##..", CultureInfo.InvariantCulture) decision.
member.param: Number of significant digits. The maximum available precision is "308"
member.returns: The Rounding Precision Specifier.
member.exception: Number of significant digits is less then 0 or more than 308.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.NumericFormat.#ctor
member.summary: Create an instance.

member.summary: specifies a number of significant digits in a coordinate.

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.PrecisionModel.Exact
member.summary: Returns an exact precision model. According to exact precision model all digits in a double value are significant.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.PrecisionModel.Rounding(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a rounding precision model. According to rounding precision model only a limited number of digits are significant.
member.remarks: When applied to a coordinate, the following code is used to reduce precision: double rounded = Math.Round(value, significantDigits);
member.returns: Rounding Precision model.
member.exception: Number of significant digits is less then 0 or more than 15.

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.PrecisionModel.SignificantDigits
member.summary: Gets a number of significant digits in a precision model if it is rounding.
member.value: Number of significant digits if this is a rounded precision model. -1 if this is an exact precision model.

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Raster.WarpOptions.Width
member.summary: Specifies output raster width in pixels and columns. If the value is set to 0, the width is automatically computed. The default value is "0".
member.remarks: If the width is set to 0, the value will be taken from the original width or computed from . Note that cannot be used with .

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Raster.WarpOptions.Height
member.summary: Specifies output raster height in pixels and columns. If the value is set to 0, the height is automatically computed. The default value is "0".
member.remarks: If the height is set to 0, the value will be taken from the original height or computed from . Note that cannot be used with .

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Raster.WarpOptions.CellWidth
member.summary: Specifies a new width of the raster cell (in target georeferenced units). If the value is set to 0, the is automatically computed. The default value is "0".
member.remarks: If the cell width is set to 0, the value will be taken from the original cell width or computed from . Note that cannot be used with .

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Raster.WarpOptions.CellHeight
member.summary: Specifies a new height of the raster cell (in target georeferenced units). If the value is set to 0, the is automatically computed. The default value is "0".
member.remarks: If the cell height is set to 0, the value will be taken from the original cell height or computed from . Note that cannot be used with .

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Raster.WarpOptions.TargetExtent
member.summary: Specifies bounds of raster layer to warp. If set to , extent is calculated during warping to include all cells from raster.

member.summary: Specifies target spatial reference. If set to , default or source spatial reference is used.

member.summary: A symbolizer that renders several other symbolizers.

member.summary: Creates new instance.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.Rendering.Symbolizers.LayeredSymbolizer.#ctor(Aspose.Gis.Rendering.Symbolizers.RenderingOrder)
member.summary: Creates new instance.
member.param:
Determines the rendering order.
- render feature with all symbolizers, then proceed to the next feature.
- render all features with a symbolizer, then proceed with drawing features to the next symbolizer.

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.Rendering.Symbolizers.LayeredSymbolizer.RenderingOrder
member.summary:
Determines the rendering order.
- render all symbolizers for the feature, then proceed to the next feature.
- render all features with the symbolizer, then proceed to the next symbolizer.

member.summary: Projected SRS is a result of application a projection to geographic SRS. A projected SRS can be two dimensional or three dimensional. If projected SRS is three dimensional, then it is actually a compound SRS of two dimensional projected SRS and one dimensional vertical SRS.

member.name: M:Aspose.Gis.SpatialReferencing.SpatialReferenceSystem.Validate(System.String@)
member.summary: Determine if this SRS is valid.
member.remarks: Valid SRS must have valid ellipsoid. - Geographic SRS must have exactly one East/West axis, exactly one North/South axis, and optional Up/Down axis (optional axis is present when geographic SRS is a compound of 2D geographic SRS and vertical SRS). - Projected SRS must have exactly one East/West axis, exactly one North/South axis, and optional Up/Down axis (optional axis is present when projected SRS is a compound of 2D geographic SRS and vertical SRS). - Geocentric SRS must have exactly one East/West axis, exactly one North/South axis and exactly one Other axis. - Vertical SRS must have exactly one Up/Down axis. - Local SRS must have at least one axis. Axises directions doesn't meter. - Compound SRS must be a combination of a valid Geographic/Projected and a valid Vertical SRS.
member.param: If method return , then this is description of invalidity.
member.returns: if SRS is valid, otherwise.

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.SpatialReferencing.SpatialReferenceSystem.IsValid
member.summary: Same as , but don't return error message.
member.returns: if SRS is valid, otherwise.

member.summary: Gets type of this SRS, see .

member.name: P:Aspose.Gis.SpatialReferencing.SpatialReferenceSystem.IsCompound
member.summary: Returns whether this SRS is compound (a union of two SRS). Following combinations of SRS in compound SRS are considered valid: Geographic SRS + Vertical SRS, in this case type of compound SRS will be . Projected SRS + Vertical SRS, in this case type of compound SRS will be . If combination of SRSs differs, type of compound SRS will be .
member.remarks: In WKT this is COMPD_CS.

member.summary: Returns whether this SRS is single (not a union of two SRS).
member.remarks: In WKT this is any coordinate system, except COMPD_CS.

member.name: T:Aspose.Gis.SpatialReferencing.SpatialReferenceSystemType
member.summary: Represents type of spatial reference system.

member.name: F:Aspose.Gis.SpatialReferencing.SpatialReferenceSystemType.Unknown
member.summary: Default value. Can be returned from if this is a compound SRS with invalid combination of underlying SRSs. See .

member.name: F:Aspose.Gis.SpatialReferencing.SpatialReferenceSystemType.Geographic
member.summary: Geographic SRS is based on angular longitude and angular latitude. Geographic SRS can be converted to via method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Gis.SpatialReferencing.SpatialReferenceSystemType.Geocentric
member.summary: Geocentric SRS is three dimensional cartesian SRS with origin at Earth center. Geocentric SRS can be converted to via method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Gis.SpatialReferencing.SpatialReferenceSystemType.Projected
member.summary: Projected SRS is based on linear X and linear Y. It is the result of application a projection on a SRS. Projected SRS can be converted to via method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Gis.SpatialReferencing.SpatialReferenceSystemType.Vertical
member.summary: Vertical SRS describes linear height coordinate. Vertical SRS can be converted to via method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Gis.SpatialReferencing.SpatialReferenceSystemType.Local
member.summary: Local SRS relates coordinates to some object, other them Earth. Local SRS can be converted to via method.
